 Total Troopship Lift

British
U.S.
 1. Estimated lift on 1 October
1945, after allowing for additions and
losses based on current C.C.S. rates 376, 000 708, 000
 2. Additional trooplift may be realized by use of cargo ships tem-
porarily fitted to carry a few hundred troops each.
 3. An indeterminable lift may be obtained from captured enemy
vessels.
 4. Lift of LSI's and APA's is not included in above inventories
but advantage will be taken of their lift whenever operational sched-
ules permit.
 5. Lift in U.S. Navy vessels as estimated and included in the above
table for normal troop movement is subject to wide variation de-
pendent upon possible utilization of Navy troopships for operational
requirements.
 6. No British cross-Channel type of shipping is included nor has
any allowance been made for possible conversions for the naval fleet
train or hospital ships.
 TTo this requirement must be added an unknown number for essential civilian
movements. [Footnote in the source text.]
